title.narrative: DACAAR activities in Afghanistan 2021

description.narrative: The proposed project aims at improving livelihoods, health and life quality on a sustainable basis for returnees, protracted IDPs and their vulnerable host communities. By the completion of the project, beneficiaries would have improved livelihoods as measured by reduced time in collecting water and increased time spent on food production, income generation and girls’ and boys’ education, improved health as measured by a reduction in water borne diseases, and an overall improvement in the quality of life as perceived by the targeted men, women, boys and girls. The integrated nature and the diverse targeting strategy of the interventions will enable addressing of the needs and priorities of the communities from different angles; access to and use of safe drinking water coupled with open defecation free villages and improved hygiene behavior will reduce the incidence of diseases (including COVID19) which will in turn enable communities to invest increased time, energy and resources into learning new skills and engaging in various farm and off farm income generating activities offered by the intervention. The interventions planned will particularly target at risk individuals and households such as women-headed households, youth susceptible to embracing negative coping mechanisms, impoverished farmers and individuals with disability. Based on learning since outbreak of Covid-19 in March 2020the interventions for this extension period will also focus on helping communities to reduce the negative economic impact of COVID19 pandemic.

participating-org.narrative: Danish Committee for Aid to Afghan Refugees

description.narrative: FL §06.32.02.15 Other Initiatives in Asia and the Middle East

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 1. (WASH) Returnees, IDPs and their host communities have access to and use safe drinking water on a sustainable basis, with water points being operated and maintained by communities

- # of girls and boys, women and men, aged and disabled using safe water from new and old water points Baseline: (TBD) Target 51,100
- # of water user groups and water management committees operating and maintaining water points Baseline: TBC Target 300 WUG, and 7 WMC
- Liters of water available per capita per day Baseline: (TBD) Target: 25 liters (rural), 40 litres (urban)
- Quality of water available. Baseline: (TBD) Target: WHO/WSG Guidelines followed
3.2 Ground water information made available to WASH sector partners

- # of new ground water monitoring wells established and data for them collected on a quarterly basis and entered into the national groundwater database Baseline: (TBD) Target: 0
-#of research and studies undertaken on groundwater in Afghanistan Baseline: (TBD) Target: 0
4.1 Targeted season-long Farmer Field Schools (FFS) convened for vulnerable farmers and producers

- #of FFS conducted and #of trainees, segregated by gender, location Baseline: (TBD) Target: 11 FFS, with 220 trainees (20% women) -% of farmers and producers successfully completed FFS, segregated by gender Baseline: (TBD) Target: 90% of 220 (20% women)
5.1 Market-driven vocational training centres convened for vulnerable youth

- #of VT centres conducted and #of trainees, segregated by gender Baseline: (TBD) Target: 3 centres with 60 trainees (40% women) - % of youth successfully completed VT centres, segregated by gender, location Baseline: (TBD) Target: 95% of 60 (40% women)
5.2. Follow up support to successful VT graduates ensured

- #of kits distributed to successful graduates Baseline: (TBD) Target: 59 (for 99% of 60 enrolled) - % of successful graduates provided with business start up grants and follow up support Baseline: (TBD) Target: 40% of 60
4.2 Small scale irrigation structures rehabilitated/reconstructed
- #of small scale irrigation structures rehabilitated/reconstructed Baseline: (TBD) Target: 25
1.1 Water points newly established or rehabilitated in coordination with communities and stakeholders

- #of water points newly constructed and rehabilitated (segregated by type of technology) Baseline: (TBD) Target: 0 new tube wells, 1,400 household connections supported by 7 pipe schemes networks, and rehabilitation of 300 non-functional water points
-% of water points selected together with women Baseline: (TBD) Target: 40%
2. (WASH) Returnees, IDPs and their host communities have improved hygiene and sanitation behaviour and practices

- % of communities declared Open Defecation Free (ODF) Baseline: (TBD) Target: 80% of 35 communities - % Households who constructed and use own latrines in ODF villages Baseline: (TBD) Target: 80% -% of people (desegregated by gender, age and disability) who know diarrhoea causes, prevention and treatment Baseline: (TBD) Target: 80%

4. (Agriculture-based Natural Resources Management): Vulnerable farmers and producers from among the returnees, IDPs and host communities have increased environmentally sustainable agricultural productivity and production

- % of trained farmers reporting an increased agriculture/livestock production (gender disaggregated) Baseline: (TBD) Target: 70% of 220
- # of farmers with improved access to irrigation water Baseline: (TBD) Target: 500
-% of trained farmers who have applied gained skills and knowledge within one year of graduation Baseline: (TBD) Target: 75% of 220
3. WASH partners at national and sub-national level have improved capacity to implement successful WASH interventions

- Level of satisfactory for WET Centre training (by clients) Baseline: (TBD) Target: 80%
-% of interested WASH cluster partners provided with free consulting support Baseline: (TBD) Target: 100%
6.1 Targeted women-led Farmer Field Schools (FFS) conducted based on needs assessments

-# of FFS conducted and #of women participants Baseline: (TBD) Target: 3 FFS with 60 women trainees
-% of women successfully graduated from FFS Baseline: (TBD) Target: 90% of 60 women trainees
2.1 Communities introduced to Afghan Context Community Led Total Sanitation (ACCLTS)
-# of communities introduced to ACLTS and committees Baseline: (TBD) Target: 35 # of natural leaders trained Baseline: (TBD) Target: 35
1.3 Existing water points in the targeted provinces are inspected for functionality (Water Point Inspection)
-# of inspections undertaken (at least once per year per water point) Baseline: (TBD) Target: 2,700
3.1 Government, NGO and private sector partners provided with WASH training and capacity building

-# of persons (desegregated by gender, and type of organization) graduated from WET Center courses Baseline: (TBD) Target: 108
-# of Action research undertaken and results disseminated Baseline: (TBD) Target: 0
6.2 Most vulnerable women headed households provided with food security packages and home based farming, and food processing training and support

-#of food security packages distributed and # of households targeted Baseline: (TBD) Target: 100 packages for same number of HHs
#of home-based farms established Baseline: (TBD) Target: 40
-# of women provided with food processing training and support Baseline: (TBD) Target: 40
1.2 Water User Groups and Water Management Committees are established for new and rehabilitated water points
-#of water user groups and water management committees established (30% participation by women) Baseline: (TBD) Target: 300 WUG and 7 WMC
6.3 Literacy course, business development conducted

-#of women enrolled in literacy courses Baseline: (TBD) Target: 200
# of women graduated from business development training Baseline: (TBD) Target: 40 CMST
6. (Women’s Empowerment): Vulnerable women from among the returnees, IDPs and their host communities have access to social, and economic resources, and capacity to empower women

-% of female beneficiaries gain social and financial status by contributing economically to their families. Baseline: (TBD) Target: 80% of 180
- % of women-headed households who have achieved improved food security Baseline: (TBD) Target: 80% of 180
- % of women with improved literacy Baseline: (TBD) Target: 90% of 200

5. (Employment and Business Creation): Sustainable income-generating and livelihood opportunities for vulnerable youth have been created in a conflict sensitive manner, leading to jobs, income, and creation of small businesses

-% of youth trainees, disaggregated by gender, who have been able to start and sustain a new business within six months of graduation. Baseline: (TBD) Target: 40% of 60 - % of youth trainees, disaggregated by gender who have become employed within six months of graduation. Baseline: (TBD) Target: 40% of 60
